question.body: Which layer is not properly matched with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: Mucosa- inner lining of the GI tract
Serosa- superficial layer that is exposed to the abdominal cavity
Muscularis- responsible for movement in the GI tract

response.feedback: Incorrect. The mucosa is the inner lining of the GI tract that consists of three layers.
Correct. Submucosa is a binding layer that contains nervous system components. The mucosa consists of three layers.
Incorrect. The serosa is exposed to the abdominal cavity.
Incorrect. The muscularis layer contains smooth and skeletal muscle to move food through the digestive system.
